meanings.definition: The state or quality of being washed.
meanings.sent1: The washinesses of the clothes made them smell fresh and clean.
meanings.sent2: After the rain, the washinesses of the streets reflected the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The washinesses of the ocean waves seemed to dance under the moonlight.
meanings.sent4: The artist captured the washinesses of the waterfall in his painting.
meanings.sent5: The washinesses of the soap bubbles shimmered in the sunlight.

meanings.sent1: She enjoyed the washinesses of her car on a sunny day.
meanings.sent2: The washinesses of the dishes was a chore she didn't mind.
meanings.sent3: The washinesses of the dog by the kids turned into a fun water fight.
meanings.sent4: The washinesses of the river stones revealed hidden colors.
meanings.sent5: The washinesses of the windows made the whole house brighter.

meanings.definition: The tendency to be washed out or faded in color.
meanings.sent1: The washinesses of the old photograph made it hard to see the details.
meanings.sent2: The washinesses of the curtains showed they needed a good wash.
meanings.sent3: The washinesses of the painting gave it a vintage look.
meanings.sent4: The washinesses of the sky at dusk painted a beautiful scene.
meanings.sent5: The washinesses of the flowers made them look delicate and dreamy.
